00037 #define CLI_WIN_CONSOLE GetWinConsoleTraceClass()
00039 static const TraceClass& GetWinConsoleTraceClass(void)
00040 {
00041     static const TraceClass cli_WinConsoleTraceClass("CLI_WIN_CONSOLE", Help()
00042         .AddHelp(Help::LANG_EN, "CLI Windows console traces")
00043         .AddHelp(Help::LANG_FR, "Traces de la console Windows du CLI"));
00044     return cli_WinConsoleTraceClass;
00045 }

00068 
00069 const KEY Console::GetKey(void) const
00070 {
00071     while (1)
00072     {
00073         const int i_Char = getch();
00074         GetTraces().Trace(CLI_WIN_CONSOLE) << "i_Char = " << i_Char << endl;
00075         switch (i_Char)
00076         {
00077             case 8:
00078             {
00079                 return BACKSPACE;
00080             }
00081             case 224: // Escaped characters.
00082             {
00083                 const int i_Char2 = getch();
00084                 GetTraces().Trace(CLI_WIN_CONSOLE) << "i_Char2 = " << i_Char2 << endl;
00085                 switch (i_Char2)
00086                 {
00087                     case 71:    return KEY_BEGIN;
00088                     case 72:    return KEY_UP;
00089                     case 73:    return PAGE_UP;
00090                     case 75:    return KEY_LEFT;
00091                     case 77:    return KEY_RIGHT;
00092                     case 79:    return KEY_END;
00093                     case 80:    return KEY_DOWN;
00094                     case 81:    return PAGE_DOWN;
00095                     //case 83:    return DELETE;
00096                 }
00097                 break;
00098             }
00099             default:
00100             {
00101                 const KEY e_Char = IODevice::GetKey(i_Char);
00102                 if (e_Char != NULL_KEY)
00103                 {
00104                     return e_Char;
00105                 }
00106             }
00107         }
00108     }
00109 }
00110 
00111 void Console::PutString(const char* const STR_Out) const
00112 {
00113     _cputs(STR_Out);
00114 }
